description.narrative: The proposed project is an investment in India Business Excellence Fund IIA (IBEF IIA or the Fund), a fund which aims to offer growth equity and strategic and operational assistance to Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in India. The investment focus will be on high growth businesses and also focused on Tier II and Tier III cities in India. The Fund aims to invest in sectors which benefit from demand led by Domestic consumption and Infrastructure enablers. The Fund is second series to India Business Excellence Fund I a 2006-07 vintage fund of US$82.5 million which is fully deployed.

i. Support of SMEs: Target investees will include SMEs, which traditionally have been capital constrained with limited access to bank debt or capital markets for financing their growth strategies. ii. Job creation: Investments in SMEs in the growth phase leads to substantial job creation, at a greater rate than the national average. iii. Private sector development: Addition of value to portfolio companies through capacity building, improved corporate governance and transparency, while providing operational, strategic and financial expertise, support in evaluating new business opportunities and building business partnerships. iv. Incorporating IFC's E&S standards, thereby contributing to sustainable economic development.
